Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a garden, playground, or forest.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate different types of living things in the land habitat, like trees, bushes, or ants.
The student can illustrate different types of living things in the water habitat, like fish or clams.
The student can compare and show different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can show patterns of diversity by depicting how different living things exist in different places.
